channel.title: The Sydney Morning Herald National Headlines
channel.description: The top National headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit http://www.smh.com.au.

item.title: Commodities markets summary
item.description: Commodities news from around the world

item.title: International markets roundup
item.description: News from the world’s major stock markets

item.title: $A higher on Euro stimulus
item.description: The Australian dollar is higher after the Bank of England's decision to introduce new stimulus measures to support the British economy.

item.title: Australian market preview
item.description: A preview of the Australian sharemarket.

item.title: Coalition targets welfare 'bludgers'
item.description: A Coalition government will 'break the cycle of idleness and habits of apathy' that can develop among those on welfare, according to leaked speaking notes.

item.title: Palmer not fit to be my opponent: Katter
item.description: Bob Katter is publicly underwhelmed by the possibility of mining billionaire Clive Palmer taking him on.

item.title: Solar companies first in hot seat over misleading carbon tax claims
item.description: THE consumer watchdog has taken on some of the nation's most powerful business peak bodies over their claims that power prices would rise by up to 20 per cent in the next year because of the carbon tax.

item.title: Weather blamed for 35% rise in insurance prices
item.description: INSURANCE premiums have risen up to 35 per cent, in some cases, in the last fortnight, amounting to hundreds of dollars a year in extra payments, with companies saying an unprecedented streak of ''extreme weather'' is the cause.

item.title: Taste of own medicine as diet pill maker told to slim down claims
item.description: Company that claims its weight-loss pills 'undo' the damage of hamburgers is ordered to retract misleading advertisements and write to customers.

item.title: First stoush on misleading carbon tax ads
item.description: The consumer watchdog takes on some of the nation's most powerful business peak bodies over their claims that power prices would rise by up to 20 per cent because of the carbon tax.

item.title: Poker sites are flush with Aussie players
item.description: Nearly 130,000 Australians are playing illegal internet poker games, with US operators raking in $68 million in one year, according to research.

item.title: India wants capital B boson in recognition of physicist
item.description: ''INDIA is like a historic father of the project,'' Paolo Giubellino, CERN spokesperson, said of the Large Hadron Collider built to discover the Higgs boson.

item.title: Next generation less likely to go boldly into new frontiers
item.description: Science needs a boost at the beginning of students' educations, and injections of capital, to keep Australia advancing, writes Bridie Smith.

item.title: All bets off as Kennett turns down Echo board
item.description: THE former Victorian Premier Jeff Kennett has abandoned his bid to join the board of casino operator Echo because of a perceived conflict of interest with his role as chairman of depression awareness group beyondblue.

item.title: Indonesia rejects Abbott 'tow back boats' vow
item.description: THE Indonesian government has confirmed that it would not accept the towing back of asylum seeker boats to its shores, sources say.

item.title: Legal online poker raises stakes for those in danger of addiction
item.description: NEARLY 130,000 Australians are playing illegal internet poker games, with US operators raking in $68 million in one year, according to new research.

item.title: Suppliers squeezed: Woolies accused
item.description: WOOLWORTHS is looking to squeeze price cuts from scores of suppliers to help fund its price war with Coles - and buyers from the supermarket giant have threatened to remove products from the shelves if the demands are not met.

item.title: Church shuttered inquiry into abuse
item.description: THE church prematurely terminated an investigation last year into the alleged failure of a top Catholic education official to take action over the sexual assault of an 11-year-old boy in the 1970s by a lay teacher.

item.title: Stilnox sleeping drug considered unsafe by review
item.description: THE sleeping drug Stilnox should no longer be considered the safe alternative to other drugs because of its links to deaths and bizarre behaviour, a review has found.

item.title: Visa delay leaves son out of Evans's Olympics
item.description: CADEL EVANS has been forced to abandon his dream of taking his family to watch him at the London Olympics because his adopted baby boy, Robel, has been unable to get a visa.

item.title: Magistrate condemns police who lied about their assault on Aboriginal man
item.description: A GROUP of police officers assaulted an Aboriginal man in a northern NSW police station then falsely claimed he had attacked them, continuing to give ''palpably false evidence'' in court despite CCTV footage clearly showing what really happened, a magistrate has found.

item.title: Men, this is a trend you can take lying down
item.description: IN A distinctive patch of Sydney a striking role reversal is gathering pace.

item.title: Illegal online poker is costing Australians $68m
item.description: Nearly 130,000 Australians are playing illegal internet poker games, with United States operators raking in $68 million in one year, according to new research.

item.title: AFL player agents warned off social media
item.description: The AFL Players' Association is telling player agents they can't approach young potential clients through social media.

item.title: Connors, coach had to be separated: Nine
item.description: The Nine Network's The Footy Show says sacked Richmond AFL player Daniel Connors' meeting with his coach almost became physical.

item.title: Farah out of Tigers-Bulldogs NRL clash
item.description: Robbie Farah's concussion in the State of Origin decider has brought renewed focus on how rugby league deals with the issue of player head knocks.

item.title: Tigers make seven changes for Demons game
item.description: Richmond have made seven changes for their AFL clash with Melbourne while Carlton have dropped ruckman Robbie Warnock.

item.title: Harrigan backs Hodges try decision
item.description: Bill Harrigan says the decision by video referee Steve Clark to award Justin Hodges' try for Queensland in Wednesday's State of Origin clash was correct.

item.title: Athletes' last chance to qualify for Games
item.description: Triple Olympian Tamsyn Manou has her last chance of qualifying for the London Olympics, while she awaits the outcome of her appeal.

item.title: NRL Eels lose Hayne for up to two weeks
item.description: Parramatta's Jarryd Hayne has revealed he suffered a foot injury in the warm-up for State of Origin III, ruling him out of the Eels' NRL clash with Manly.

item.title: Mokbel to appeal against sentence
item.description: Drug lord Tony Mokbel will appeal his 30-year sentence, which his lawyers say fails to reflect the time he's already spent behind bars.

item.title: Exporters undaunted by slowing China
item.description: Exporters appear to done better in the June quarter than in the previous three months, which should prove a boost to economic growth.

item.title: Bledisloe drought must end: O'Neill
item.description: John O'Neill says Australia's Bledisloe Cup drought must come to an end and he believes a series win over the All Blacks is critical.

item.title: Rinehart sells down stake in Fairfax
item.description: Mining billionaire Gina Rinehart has reduced her stake in Fairfax Media amid a dispute about her push to join the company's board.

item.title: AFP gets new disaster response group
item.description: The new Specialist Response Group (SRG) of the Australian Federal Police will be based in Canberra.

item.title: Bob Brown backs Walsh in ATO stoush
item.description: Eccentric Tasmanian gambling millionaire David Walsh has found an ally in former Greens leader Bob Brown.

item.title: Sydney Water workers threaten strikes
item.description: Sydney Water workers have rallied in Sydney and Wollongong over planned job cuts, saying there will be day-long strikes if further cuts go ahead.

item.title: Giddings defends Overland appointment
item.description: The choice of former Victoria Police chief Simon Overland to head a government department in Tasmania has raised eyebrows.

item.title: Beau to replace Gill for Reds rugby clash
item.description: Queensland will be without rising flanker Liam Gill and Wallabies winger Digby Ioane for their must-win Super Rugby clash with the Highlanders.

item.title: Woman charged over David Rixon murder
item.description: A 29-year-old woman is the fourth person to be charged over the murder of a Tamworth policeman in March.

item.title: Brumbies deny there's Super pressure
item.description: Brumbies enforcer Ben Alexander says the Australian conference leaders aren't feeling the pressure heading into their Super Rugby derby with NSW.

item.title: AFL star Goodes happy again
item.description: Sydney AFL icon Adam Goodes has hailed the club's younger players and revealed feelings of frustration and naivety after battling with injury.

item.title: Govt defends boat rescue policy
item.description: Boats carrying asylum seekers do make "early" calls to authorities but it's nothing new, the federal government and Australian Federal Police say.

item.title: Combet takes aim at 'evil price gouging'
item.description: Greg Combet says refrigerant company Heatcraft is "just taking the opportunity to jack up prices" following the introduction of Labor's carbon tax.

item.title: Davison ready for Townsville V8 glory
item.description: V8 Supercars title contender Will Davison has never won on the streets of Townsville but the Ford star is keen to correct that stat this weekend.

item.title: Australia to oppose Korean whaling plan
item.description: Our top diplomat in Seoul will tell the South Korean government that Australia is opposed to its plan to resume whaling.

item.title: Sica to appeal murder conviction: lawyer
item.description: Triple murderer Max Sica will appeal his life sentence and non-parole period of 35 years, the longest in Queensland history.

item.title: Abbott spruiks boat turn-around policy
item.description: The Australian navy would be able to take 'necessary steps' to get asylum seeker boats to turn back under coalition policy, Tony Abbott says.

item.title: NSW eyes $250 emergency services tax
item.description: A new tax of about $250 per year could be imposed on NSW property owners to pay for emergency services.

item.title: Trade balance to improve, economists
item.description: Economists expect Australia's trade balance to return to surplus in the coming months due to rising exports to Asia.

item.title: Accused decapitator prepares bail case
item.description: A man accused of decapitating another man on the NSW north coast has had his case heard in a Sydney court, with lawyers foreshadowing he may yet seek bail.

item.title: Dave Taylor sorry over one-finger salute
item.description: South Sydney forward Dave Taylor says he didn't intend to offend anyone when he flipped the bird during Queensland 21-20 Origin win on Wednesday night.

item.title: Scientists still giddy over particles
item.description: Scientists gathered in Melbourne can't stop talking about the new particle discovery announced with great fanfare around the world.

item.title: No hidden story over pill duo: Hardwick
item.description: Richmond coach Damien Hardwick is making no apologies for his AFL club's stance in axing Daniel Connors and suspending Dustin Martin.

item.title: Trade deficit widens for May
item.description: Australia's trade deficit widened in May, according to ABS data released on Thursday.

item.title: Foley set to stay on as Waratahs coach
item.description: Michael Foley's job appears safe, however he hasn't received any support from the ARU over his complaints about Test rugby scheduling.

item.title: Pies' Pendlebury to miss one more week
item.description: Collingwood vice-captain Scott Pendlebury will miss the AFL match against Carlton as the Magpies take a cautious approach to his leg injury.

item.title: PMP blocks suitor from access to books
item.description: Printer-publisher PMP has blocked suitor TMA from conducting due dilligence as part of its bid.

item.title: LNP ruled by Palmer, says Swan
item.description: Billionaire Clive Palmer will dictate the direction of the Liberal National Party whether or not he is an election candidate, says Treasurer Wayne Swan.

item.title: Sica 'stunned' by guilty verdict: wife
item.description: Shortly before Max Sica's sentencing, his wife Shiva has released a statement saying her husband was "stunned" to be found guilty of a triple murder.

item.title: Leighton sacks manager over Iraq bribes
item.description: Construction firm Leighton has sacked a senior manager linked to bribery allegations despite federal police not completing their investigation.

item.title: Bonds up on weaker Chinese equities
item.description: Ten year bond futures prices are at their highest point for a week on weaker Chinese share market performances.

item.title: Flight Centre bucks weak retail trend
item.description: Travel agency Flight Centre has lifted its full year profit guidance as its growing international presence overcomes weakness in the local retail sector.

item.title: Aussie MPs slam South Korea whaling plans
item.description: The Australian government, the opposition and the Greens are all indignant at South Korea's plan to resume whaling.

item.title: Stocks to watch at close on Thursday
item.description: Stocks of interest on the Australian Securities Exchange at close on Thursday

item.title: International markets roundup
item.description: News from the world’s major stock markets

item.title: $A drops ahead of central bank meetings
item.description: The Australian dollar is lower ahead of key meetings of the European Central Bank and Bank of England.

item.title: Market closes flat
item.description: The Australian share market had a flat day on very light volumes, shaken up by a large sale of Fairfax shares

item.title: Bakery roasted over bid to gouge
item.description: THE bakery chain Brumby's has apologised unreservedly after it attracted the ire of the government and the competition watchdog for advising its outlets to raise their prices and blame the carbon tax.

item.title: Big polluters convinced carbon price is here to stay
item.description: EVEN if the carbon price is repealed by a Tony Abbott government, it is likely to be brought back again within a few years, according to a survey of experts who work for the heaviest-polluting companies.

item.title: Exposed MPs warn Labor over challenges
item.description: NSW federal Labor MPs are warning of instability should any of them face preselection challenges while they are fighting to retain their seats in the face of a looming election defeat.

item.title: GPS backpacks on turtles in study to protect species
item.description: Custom designed 'GPS backpacks' are attached to turtles living on the Murray River east of Echuca, as scientists try to learn more about where turtles go.

item.title: Navy shadows another refugee boat in distress
item.description: A CROWDED asylum seeker boat refused warnings to turn back to Indonesia in rough waters yesterday, despite a message to search and rescue authorities saying the vessel was in distress.

item.title: NSW Nationals chief may throw hat in the ring for Hume contest
item.description: THE NSW upper house MP Niall Blair has left open the option of running for preselection as the Nationals candidate for the federal seat of Hume, joining other potential candidates including the Minister for Primary Industries, Katrina Hodgkinson, and the senator Fiona Nash.

item.title: Palmer declares he'd be a 'fantastic' MP but Abbott's not interested
item.description: TONY ABBOTT has publicly urged Clive Palmer to drop his bid to enter Federal Parliament, suggesting the mining billionaire and Liberal National Party donor was not the type of candidate the Coalition needed.

item.title: Abbott backs Brough selection bid
item.description: Tony Abbott boosts former minister Mal Brough's campaign for Liberal National Party preselection in Fisher.

item.title: Freedom fighter's new frontier
item.description: David Nyuol Vincent survived a childhood in war-torn Sudan and 17 years in a refugee camp. Now he continues the struggle for peace as an Australian.

item.title: Drivers were big spenders in June
item.description: Low interest rates and carbon tax compensation payments propelled consumer spending, making June the biggest month for motor vehicle sales in Australian history.

item.title: 'Smuggle' crews score win in court
item.description: Prosecutors will have to prove that Indonesian crews on boats carrying asylum seekers to Christmas Island were aware their destination was part of Australia for them to be found guilty of people smuggling.

item.title: Navy vessels rescue boat asylum seekers
item.description: Asylum seekers on a stricken boat are transferred to Australian naval ships in rough seas near Christmas Island.

item.title: Washer writes off MPs' group effort
item.description: Liberal moderate Mal Washer, one of the cross-party MPs trying to get a compromise on asylum seeker policy, writes off the group as 'buggered'.

item.title: Drug firms agree to declare doctor payments
item.description: DRUG companies have agreed to disclose the total amount they pay to doctors to attend seminars or serve on advisory boards, but say any move to name individual doctors receiving the payments could be years away.

item.title: Ugg boot sales drop as market falls to fleeces
item.description: A SLUMP in overseas sales of the classic Australian ugg boot has triggered a collapse in global sheepskin prices and left farmers with a pittance for their once highly prized hides.

item.title: Clemency for Corby upheld
item.description: A LEGAL attempt to overturn Schapelle Corby's clemency has fallen at the first hurdle, with a judge telling the hard-line anti-drug group that brought the case its argument was not valid.

item.title: Hancock not convinced woman is his aunt
item.description: GINA RINEHART'S son, John Hancock, has spoken publicly for the first time about Aboriginal elder Hilda Kickett, casting doubt on her claims that she is the illegitimate daughter of his grandfather, Lang Hancock.

item.title: Single embryo IVF transfers have better chance of survival
item.description: THE chance that a baby conceived using in-vitro fertilisation will be stillborn or die soon after birth is reduced dramatically when only a single embryo is returned to the mother's uterus, according to a Sydney study that adds powerful extra weight to specialists' campaign against double embryo transfer.

item.title: Missing ingredient: know your Higgs boson
item.description: We answer seven questions about the Higgs boson.

item.title: At seven, Sophie's already on the fairway to stardom
item.description: AT TWO, she picked up her first golf club. Now Sophie Yip, who turns eight this month, will test her skills on the world stage.

item.title: Killed soldier was highly decorated
item.description: The SAS patrol commander who was killed in operations in Afghanistan on Monday was a highly-decorated soldier and father of two, according to an Australian Defence Force statement.

item.title: Nanny's attacker remains a mystery
item.description: NEARLY 21 years after the death of a young nanny found ''horrifically bashed'' on the side of a northern NSW road, a second inquest has failed to shed light on her attacker's identity.

item.title: Origin of the universe revealed
item.description: Scientists take a giant leap in their understanding of how the universe was formed, with a joint announcement in Geneva and Melbourne that a new particle has been discovered.

item.title: Mental health probs higher in prisons
item.description: About a third of prisoners in Australia have 2.5 times the mental health issues experienced by average Australians, a new report shows.

item.title: Asylum seekers rescued in rough seas
item.description: Australian authorities say 162 people are en route to Christmas Island following a lengthy rescue operation hampered by rough seas.

item.title: Commitment to Origin colours wanes
item.description: More heartache for Blues fans.

item.title: Blues players call for Stuart to stay
item.description: Blues players want Ricky Stuart to remain as coach next year to stop Queensland's State of Origin dominance.

item.title: MPs don't want Hoddle St killer released
item.description: Politicians from both sides of the fence agree on one thing - Hoddle Street killer Julian Knight should never be released from jail.

item.title: Gallen hopeful Stuart will stay with NSW
item.description: NSW skipper Paul Gallen says Ricky Stuart can coach the Blues and hold down a NRL post in 2013.

item.title: Palmer considers run against Katter
item.description: Mining magnate Clive Palmer says he is considering running for Liberal National Party preselection in one of two Queensland seats.

item.title: Cronk's field goal no surprise to Petero
item.description: Petero Civoniceva goes out a winner and says that's the way it will stay with no chance of a rugby league return in 2013.

item.title: Soldier killed in Afghanistan named
item.description: The Special Air Service Regiment soldier killed in action in Afghanistan this week has been named as father-of-two Blaine Diddams, who was born in Canberra.
